author: avdaredevil
body: Could you please allow for [PowerLine Patched fonts](https://github.com/powerline/fonts) to be enabled in PowerShell so that customizations and interactivity such as [Oh-My-Zsh](https://github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh) could be brought right into PowerShell!

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
I don't think this is a PowerShell issue - we rely on the underlying console subsystem for fonts.

I thought powerline fonts worked, this comment suggests they do: https://github.com/Microsoft/BashOnWindows/issues/279#issuecomment-218726174

If you do have issues with the powerline fonts, I suggest searching https://github.com/Microsoft/BashOnWindows/issues to see if the issue is known/solved and open a new issue if you don't fine an existing one.

comments.author: Jaykul
comments.body: Yeah, they work. Some of them may not show up in the Windows conhost properties dialog because they're not truly monospaced ... https://github.com/jaykul/powerline

comments.author: avdaredevil
comments.body:
Gotcha, sorry for misunderstanding the problem... I realized that PowerShell_ISE is able to render much more characters than the Shell counterpart, as it creates its own shell. Hence, the confusion. I still managed to hack together something like Zsh.

Thanks, it still looks awesome!

title: [Feature Request] Allow support for PowerLine Fonts in PowerShell
